definition: to run away/to go into exile
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: Many people deserted their homes during the food shortage.
sentences.chinese: 許多人在饑荒中逃往他鄉。

sentences.english: A group of chickens are planning to escape Tweedy's Farm.
sentences.chinese: 一羣特威迪農場的小雞正在策劃逃往。

sentences.english: Families fled for Iran or for the hills.
sentences.chinese: 家家戶戶逃往伊朗或者山區。

sentences.english: After three years, Jung escaped to South Korea in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 三年後，鄭光日於2003年逃往韓國。

sentences.english: Bethel After deceiving his brother, Jacob left Beer-sheba and fled to Haran.
sentences.chinese: 雅各欺騙哥哥以掃以後，離開別是巴，逃往哈蘭。

sentences.english: The president of Haiti is forced to flee to Africa.
sentences.chinese: 連海地的總統也被逼要逃往非洲去。

sentences.english: She got a new name, and quickly moved to South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 然後王千源就有了個新的名字，迅速逃往韓國。

sentences.english: After killing the local tyrant Zhen Guanxi， for fear of being jailed， Lu Zhishen fled to Mount Wutai where he stayed in a temple as a monk.
sentences.chinese: 魯智深打死惡霸鎮關西后，怕喫官司，逃往他低。

sentences.english: Fawkes was to light the fuse and escape to continental Europe.
sentences.chinese: 福克斯負責點燃導火索，然後逃往歐洲大陸。

sentences.english: He would not comment on which country the couple may have fled to.
sentences.chinese: 他未透露這對情侶可能逃往了哪個國家。

sentences.english: With a warrant out for his arrest, Christophe escaped to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 由於已經發出了逮捕狀，克利斯朵夫只好逃往巴黎。

sentences.english: He escaped to South America with his ill-gotten gains .
sentences.chinese: 他帶着不義之財逃往南美。

sentences.english: Fled to peiping road, two men met horse small wan.
sentences.chinese: 逃往北平路上，二人結識了馬小宛。
那名恐怖分子逃往亞特蘭大。

sentences.english: He arrived in the land of Midian, and sat down beside a well.
sentences.chinese: 逃往米甸，並且在一口井邊定居。

sentences.english: And king Antiochus pursued after him, and he fled along by the sea coast and came to Dora.
sentences.chinese: 安提約古王追擊他，他只得逃往臨海的多辣去了。

definition: to flee abroad/to run away/to desert/outflow
to run off in a great panic (idiom)
refuge/to take refuge/to seek asylum (political etc)
to run away/to flee in disarray
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
